keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations

lead_paragraph: The global count of hungry people has fallen from about one billion 25 years ago to 795 million today, the United Nations says, or about one person out of every nine.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | United Nations; Hunger Declines Sharply, Report Says
headline.main: U.N. Reports About 200 Million Fewer Hungry People Than in 1990

snippet: The global count of hungry people has fallen from about one billion 25 years ago to 795 million today, the United Nations says, or about one person out of every nine.
abstract: United Nations' annual hunger report shows global hunger in decline, despite spike in population growth; finds that 72 of 129 nations monitored by Food and Agricultural Organization have achieved Millennium Development goal of cutting percentage of hungry people in their populations in half.
